event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Latvia after Ice Age retreat
Baltic tribes establish farming communities and regional cultures
Viking trade routes link Latvia to the Baltic and Eastern Europe
Riga is founded as a German trading and missionary center
Crusading orders establish control over much of Latvia
Riga joins the Hanseatic League as a major Baltic port
Livonian Order collapses; region falls under Polish-Lithuanian influence
Sweden captures Riga, integrating Latvia into the Swedish Empire
Russia gains control after the Great Northern War
German landowning elite dominates society under Russian rule
Latvia declares independence after World War I
Soviet occupation begins under World War II agreements
Nazi occupation devastates Jewish and urban communities
Soviet rule is reimposed after World War II
Latvia restores independence with the collapse of the Soviet Union
Latvia joins the European Union and NATO
